greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least natural number with the same prime signature Stern polynomial B(n,x) has when it is factored over Z.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: a(1) = 1 (by convention), and for n > 1, a(n) = A284010(A260443(n)).
example: B_9(x) = x^2 + 2x + 1, which factorizes as (x + 1)^2, thus a(9) = 2^2 = 4.
program: \\ After _Charles R Greathouse IV_'s code in A046523 and A186891:
xref: Differs from A046523 for the first time at n=25, where a(25) = 2, while A046523(25) = 4.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 20 2017
